title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez were sentenced to federal prison for stealing and depositing checks from the mail.
Rios-Franco received a 35-month sentence and must pay $12,528 in restitution, while Baez got a two-year sentence and $10,285 restitution.
The scheme involved washing ink from stolen checks and depositing them into controlled accounts from June 2023 to February 2024.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, a Milford teen detained by ICE last year, was invited to the State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes, originally from Brazil, was detained in May 2025 in a collateral arrest targeting his father, leading to significant community support.
Held under harsh conditions, Gomes' arrest highlights broken immigration system issues, according to Moulton, who emphasizes uplifting immigrant youth.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a regrettable center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark at the Olympics.
Swayman humorously dismissed the impact of color differences on the ice, joking about being colorblind.
Team USA is well-positioned with other top goaltenders despite Swayman's mediocre performance against Denmark.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum's potential return from an Achilles injury could impact the Boston Celtics' playoff push.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony anticipate Tatum's return to elevate the Celtics' chances in the postseason.
Tatum's recent practice with Celtics' G League affiliate suggests progress in his recovery and return to form.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots have approximately $41 million in cap space available for this offseason.
Potential free agents for the Patriots include Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker.
Patriots have needs at positions like TE and EDGE; Ravens' Isaiah Likely and Eagles' Jaelan Phillips are options.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV announced a partnership making ESPN the streaming home for MLB games starting in 2026.
MLB.TV is an add-on to ESPN Unlimited, costing $134.99 for subscribers and $149.99 for non-subscribers.
Non-subscribers to ESPN Unlimited get a free month trial, but automatic renewal is $29.99 monthly afterward.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a recent practice with the Maine Celtics, sparking speculation about his return this season.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum’s performance, indicating he played like himself during practice.
Despite Tatum's G League practice, his official status remains unchanged, with no timeline given for a return to games.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranks as the most educated state in the U.S. in the WalletHub 2026 study.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree, highest in the nation; 22% hold advanced degrees.
Vermont and Maryland follow Massachusetts, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia rank at the bottom.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: The rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card will be auctioned by Ken Goldin; bidding closes February 21.
The card, kept in a family collection for 116 years, is expected to fetch over $4.7 million.
The card's original owner had ties to Massachusetts through a sterling silver plant in Taunton.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start for Team USA in Saturday's Winter Olympics game against Denmark, marking his Olympic debut.
Swayman has a 22-12-3 record with a 2.92 GAA and a .903 save percentage for the 2025-26 Bruins season.
Team USA plays Germany on Sunday, with no starter announced yet; Swayman joins Bruins teammate Charlie McAvoy on the ice.
